content.question: Matrix multiplication can be used to encode written messages that have been converted to numbers. Matrix <math alttext="A equals a 2 by 2 matrix with row 1 column 1 value 1, row 1 column 2 value negative 2, row 2 column 1 value negative 5, row 2 column 2 value 3"><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math> is the key for encoding messages. That is, if matrix <math alttext="B"><mi>B</mi></math> is the original message, then <math alttext="A B"><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi></math> is the encoded message. If <math alttext="B equals a 2 by 1 matrix with row 1 column 1 value 5, row 2 column 1 value 9"><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>9</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>, what is the encoded message?

choices.label: <math alttext="a 2 by 1 matrix with row 1 column 1 value negative 13, row 2 column 1 value 2"><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>13</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="a 2 by 1 matrix with row 1 column 1 value negative 1, row 2 column 1 value 30"><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>30</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="a 2 by 1 matrix with row 1 column 1 value 32, row 2 column 1 value negative 55"><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>32</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>55</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="a 2 by 1 matrix with row 1 column 1 value 40, row 2 column 1 value 17"><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>40</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>17</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="a 2 by 1 matrix with row 1 column 1 value negative 13, row 2 column 1 value 2"><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>13</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
